alert.note: Alert for Gulf; Liberty (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 26 at 7:23AM EDT until September 26 at 9:00AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 AM CDT/930 AM EDT/ THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Big Bend and Panhandle Florida, including the following counties, in Big Bend Florida, Liberty. In Panhandle Florida, Bay and Gulf. * WHEN...Until 830 AM CDT /930 AM EDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 623 AM CDT /723 AM EDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Port St. Joe, Mexico Beach, Wewahitchka, Stonemill Creek, Tyndall Air Force Base, White City, Milltown, Highland View, Saint Joe Beach, Dalkeith, Overstreet, Beacon Hill, Honeyville, Ward Ridge, Jones Homestead, Willis Landing, Howard Creek, Simmons Bayou and Odena. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
